column5: Well, I managed to catch my first musky this evening, so as you can imagine I'm pretty pumped. I was chucking around a slopmaster of all things when it hit and I immediately started yelling musky, musky! I knew it wasn't a a bass but for a split second I was disappointed because it occured to me that I might have somehow foulhooked a carp as there are tons here. Even when it broke the surface I still wasn't convinced because after what must be close to that 10000 cast number you start to think you are never going to get one. It wasn't  all that big by musky standards, maybe 36" tops and lean,  and it probably looks smaller than that in the pic  because I was too busy trying to keep it from hurting itself (or me) to pose with it arms extended but it was really awesome nonetheless. From start to finish, hooked, landed, photoed and released must of been  3 minutes tops.  Swam away as strong as it came in. Really cool to know that you can get them without a boat too. Thanks both to all those on this board who have given me advice either directly or indirectly and to all the local anglers who unselfishly pointed me in the right direction. I have a crappy cell phone pic which I'll post once I figure out how.

Way to go Weeds!!! 1st musky is always a rush! Mine also came from Peterborough ( Chemong ) only I was trolling for walleye with a 5 foot ultra lite and using a #2 mepps - remember it like it was yesterday! Congrats! - now work on #2 And lets see that picture!   Don
I (as in with the help of the wife) will post the pic tomorrow. Hopefully. Thanks for the congrats. Can't wait to get to work on #2!!
WOW, congrats Weeds... I am still in search of Musky, so your story gives me back a whole lot of hope.  You must have been on cloud nine.  Way to go!  Look forward to the picture.  Cheers Jen
Congrats Weeds, can feel the adrenaline through your post even without the pic (but damn it don't taunt us like that - we need pics!   )

Attaboy Weeds.   I remember how excited I was when I caught my first one a couple years ago.  Daggone it ... I'm still waiting to catch my second one.   Congrats for your first ski !   Better get that camera in operation for your next cast ... ya just never know.
Good stuff, I hope to get my first this year  Maureen

Tried adding the pic as link. Not sure how to do it otherwise. What a crappy little pic....Oh well. http://s185.photobucket.com/albums/x305/ro...iewÂ¤t=musky.jpg Hmmmm. Seemed to work a second ago........lemme try again. http://i185.photobucket.com/albums/x305/ro...shing/musky.jpg Yeah, I always had alot of problems trying to program the VCR too...........
Looks like the first muskie I caught too - see my avatar.  Also in the Kawarthas - congrats.

NICE!!!!!!!!Congrats on your first musky,  you will remember that fish forever,and like all the rest of us you are now hooked for sure,you will now spend 20,000 hours persuing these elusive fish.......so you might as well get used to it now.  ..lol..lol..go get some musky magazines,oh ya and dont forget to be a member of muskies canada.  ....you did it to yourself........cheers
Ahh nice going weeds.  Can't wait to see the pic.  dsn
Congrats on your first musky Weeds
Congrats on losing your cherry!!! I guess that the local tackle shops will be seeing more of you over the next while as you have been bitten by the BUG!!! I hope you catch tons more.
Congrats on your 1st ever musky.  The 1st one is always the hardest to catch, it gets alot easier from now on !!
Hey man thats a great first ski!  Gotta love the colors.  Youre hooked now - man that green is beaut!

well done!  Lew is exactly right.  Next one won't be as tough to find.  I took 4 straight days on GBay with nothing when I first started musky fishing, then went to Nipissing and caught 2 in a day!  Keep at it and you'll get your hours down.
